tl: Ayon sa Highway Patrol Group, umabot sa mahigit 1,000 aksidente ang kinasangkutan ng mga tricycle nitong nakaraang taon. Batay sa batas, apat lang dapat ang sakay ng tricycle--ang rider, ang backride, at dalawang sakay sa sidecar. Pero madalas na umaabot sa lima hanggang anim ang sakay ng mga tricycle kaya nagiging overloaded ang sasakyan. Tunghayan sa video na ito ng "Alisto" ang isinagawang demo kung paano nakaaapekto ang bilang ng pasahero sa takbo at pagtigil ng tricycle. Sa naturang demo, dalawang tricycle [isang overload at isang hindi] ang sabay na tatakbo sa magkatulad na bilis, at sabay titigil sa isang lugar. Alamin ang resulta ng demo at ang iba pang tips para makapag-ingat ang driver sa pagmamaneho. Panoorin.
en: According to the highway patrol group, over 1,000 accidents have been involved in the tricycles last year. And one of the reasons why tricycles are involved in accidents are due to its overloaded. Based on the law, only four should be the tricycle - the rider, the backride, and two rides on the sidecar. But it often reaches five to six to six the tricycles so the vehicle becomes overloaded. See this "alert" video is the demo of how the passenger number affects the trend and stopping the tricycle. In such a demo, two tricycles [an overload and one not] will be operated at the same speed, and simultaneously stop at one place. Determine the demo result and the other tips to keep driver driving. Watch.

tl: Inabsuwelto ng Sandiganbayan nitong Biyernes sa kasong pandarambong si dating Senador Ramon "Bong" Revilla Jr. kaugnay sa umano'y maanomalyang paggamit sa kaniyang Priority Development Assistance Fund (PDAF), na kilala rin sa tawag na pork barrel fund. Gayunman, guilty naman ang hatol ng anti-graft court sa mga kapwa akusado ni Revilla na sina Janet Lim Napoles at Atty. Richard Cambe, at sinentensiyahan ng "reclusion perpetua." Si Cambe ay dating tauhan ni Revilla sa Senado, habang negosyante naman si Napoles, at itinuturong utak umano sa naturang scam. Inutusan din ng korte sina Napoles at Cambe na ibalik ang "solidarily" ang P124 milyon sa pamahalaan. Hindi na rin sila maaaring humawak ng anumang posisyon sa gobyerno. Matapos maabsuwelto, kaagad na naglagak si Revilla ng P480,000 na piyansa para sa hiwalay na kasong katiwalian na kaniyang kinakaharap para sa kaniyang pansamantalang kalayaan. "Of course because I know that I'm not guilty. Noon ko pa sinasabi na wala akong kasalanan," sabi ni Revilla kaugnay sa naging desisyon ng korte. Ang Sandiganbayan First Division na may limang mahistrado ang duminig sa naturang kaso at 3-2 ang naging boto para pawalang-sala si Revilla. Sina Associate Justices Geraldine Faith Econg, Edgardo Caldona at Associate Justice Georgina Hidalgo, ang bumoto para pawalang-sala si Revilla. Samantalang sina Associate Justice Efren Dela Cruz at Associate Justice Ma. Theresa Dolores Gomez-Estoesta, ang kontra.
en: The Sandiganbayan on Friday in the case of plunderer Senator Ramon "Bong" Revilla Jr. In relation to the alleged use of his Priority Development Assistance Fund (PDAF), also known as the Pork Barrel Fund call. However, the anti-graft court judgment on the fellow Defendants of Revilla Janet Lim Napoles and Atty. Richard Cambe, and sentenced to "Reclusion Perpetua." Cambe was a former revilla personnel in the Senate, while Napoles, and the brain was allegedly in the scam. The Court also ordered Napoles and Cambe to restore "solidarily" P124 million to the government. They can not even hold any position in the government. After rebelling, Revilla immediately took P480,000 bail for a separate case of corruption that he faced for his temporary freedom. "Of course because I know that I'm not guilty. I said I was saying that I had no sin," Revilla said in conjunction with the court's decision. The Sandiganbayan First Division with five magistrates heard in such a case and 3-2 became a vote to justify Revilla. Associate Justices Geraldine Faith Econg, Edgardo Caldona and Associate Justice Georgina Hidalgo, voted to justify Revilla. While Associate Justice Efren Dela Cruz and Associate Justice Ma. Theresa Dolores Gomez-Estoyta, the counter.
